Pb, Rajasthan NGOs meet Jal Shakti minis.description: LUDHIANA: Taking up the issue of rising pollution in Buddha Nullah and Satluj river, the members of Naroa Punjab Manch and Tapovan Trust from Rajasthan met Union minister of Jal Shakti Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Thursday and submitted an action plan for the same. The action plan has given major thrust on the timely completion of common effluent treatment plants (CETPs) and upgrade of sewage treatment plants (STPs). Members have also demanded closure of illegal points from where effluents or domestic sewage are released in the drain. The members suggested that all CETPs should be completed at the earliest and treated water should be sent back to industries for re-use. The suggestions also included new STPs to tap illegal disposal of domestic sewage waste in Buddha Nullah, use of treated water from STPs for irrigation purposes and formation of Special Task Force comprising central officials as well as local professionals, ecologists to monitor the progress. Kapil Arora, a city-based engineer and a consultant with Naroa Punjab Manch, said they have suggested identification and disconnection of all illegal connections laid down by dyeing industries and dairies to throw untreated industrial effluents and animal excreta in Buddha Nullah. The electricity connection of any industry/dairies must be disconnected and it should be banned forever, the NGOs have demanded. The NGOs have suggested construction of two dairy complexes, one at Hambran Road and another at Tajpur Road with facilities like biogas plant by PEDA and solar energy operated plant for drying and conversion of animal excreta into wooden logged shaped fuel with at least double the capacity of dairies at present. The high-resolution cameras (day and night vision) must be installed along Buddha Nullah as well as in industrial area/dairy complexes to keep a check on dumping of solid waste as well as disposal of untreated effluents in the drain. All the submersible pumps installed by industries and dairies on Tajpur Road must be closed with solid material so as to stop seeping of industrial water into groundwater. The water supply to residents of Ludhiana must also be restricted and through water meters only, the members have suggested. After listening to the issues, the minister said he too is affected with the problem as he belongs to Rajasthan and owns land in Sri Ganganagar. The matter will be taken up as soon as possible and further they will get the present status of all ongoing cases in courts as well as with NGT, he said. He said contamination of water is a serious crime and it will be taken up to provide relief to both the states, but the state governments must also act positively in this direction to eradicate the problem. MC may impose service charges to lift ga.description: Ludhiana: After issuing a warning to residents not to throw garbage in vacant plots in areas near them, the civic body is now planning to impose service charges for cleaning these vacant plots. Usually, area councillors or other political persons ask civic officials to lift garbage collected in plots, and the civic body bears the expenses. In the meeting of the Finance and Contracts Committee (F&CC), members will take a decision in this regard on Thursday. It has been proposed that the owner of that vacant plot should pay service charges to the civic body. For cleaning, the 200 square yards of plot, the owner would be asked to pay Rs5,000; for 500 square yards plot, it would be Rs10,000; and above 500 square yards, the amount would be Rs25,000. Last year, MC had issued a public notice to residents not to throw garbage in vacant plots, and if such a thing happened, then the owners would have to get the plot cleaned within three days. Also, owners had to ensure garbage was not thrown inside the plots again. However, the warning went unnoticed because after that, civic officials did not conduct any checking in the areas. Roughly, there are over 30,000 vacant plots in the city, and officials blamed lack of staff for not conducting checkings at the ground level. However, it is now proposed that MC should recover charges from the owner, because when they clean the plots, the fuel, machinery, and energy of employees is used. It is to be seen whether F&CC members approve this agenda or not. Mayor Balkar Sandhu said the meeting would take place on Thursday, and the proposal would be discussed with members, after which approval would be given. On the other hand, residents claimed MC had the right to impose penalty only if they were providing facilities. Haibowal resident Harish Batra said: “There is no facility of door-to-door garbage lifting in the entire city, and private garbage collectors are taking away garbage. But they do not come regularly, so people have to throw garbage inside plots.” A Maya Nagar resident said: “The owner should not be held responsible for garbage in his plot, as he is not asking people to throw garbage there. It is the responsibility of civic officials to check such people who are throwing garbage wherever they feel like.” PROPOSED RATES * Plot within 200sq yards: Rs5,000 * Plot from 200-500 sq yards: Rs10,000 * Plot above 500sq yards: Rs25,000 Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Post inquiry, panel recommends action ag.description: Ludhiana: After an enquiry report on the orders of the civil surgeon, a board was constituted to enquire the treatment of a patient, Ramandeep Kaur, 27, from Rajgarh Tehsil village, Raikot, whose kin helped her deliver a pre-mature baby. They further complained to the SMO Dr Geeta and a board of doctors was formed. The board is of the opinion that the medical team was not present by the side of the patient, Ramandeep Kaur, resultant to which she delivered a pre-mature baby on her bed. Gynaecologist Dr Baljeet Kaur was not informed about the condition of the patient. Hence, action has been recommended against Dr Nisha Kumari (DNB resident), Dr Nisha Tiwari (DNB resident), staff nurses Harwinder Kaur and Sarbjeet Kaur. The board comprises of Dr Varun Saar, surgical specialist; Surbhi Singhal, gynaecologist; Dr Gurbinder Kaur (EMO) along with Dr Geeta, Senior Medical Officer (SMO). The doctors said the attendants were explained about the poor prognosis and inevitable abortion and the consent was signed by Daljeet Kaur (her mother-in-law) at 6.30 pm. The patient was again examined at the same time by the doctor on duty and the labour had progressed and patient was dilated 3-4 cms. The patient was told to stand in the queue, but due to pain, she sat on the doctor’s table. The sweeper also told her to go on her bed. The staff was busy with PV examination of other patients. In the meanwhile, Ramandeep Kaur developed sudden labour pain and delivered a pre-mature baby on her bed. She was immediately shifted to the labour table and the necessary treatment was given. The report states that the attendants of the patients have alleged that they requested the staff on duty time and again to examine the patient when she in pain on her bed, but no doctor came to attend her. Dr Nisha Kumari (DNB resident) said she along with the staff nurses Harwinder and Sarabjeet Kaur were attending to two patients in active labour, who delivered by NVD with episiotomy at 9.30 pm and 9.45 pm, respectively. The staff on duty categorically said the attendants misbehaved with them and used foul language. The patient herself took lama at 11.30pm in stable condition. However, this is observed that one of the staff nurse could have been sent to examine and pacify the patient. ------------------------------------- THE CASE After going through the record, statements and interim report submitted by the board of doctors of the Civil Hospital, it was observed that the patient was refereed from the CHC Pakhowal in pain and bleeding to the Civil Hospital. The patient was admitted to the Civil Hospital, Ludhiana, at 2.30pm on June 6 and inevitable abortion was diagnosed. Dr Baljeet Kaur, gynaecologist, was on call duty from 2pm to 8am. Dr Nisha Kumari (DNB resident), Dr Nisha Tiwari (DNB resident), staff nurses Harwinder Kaur and Sarbjeet Kaur attended to the patient. Also, the patient delivered a pre-mature baby on her bed and was shifted to the labour room and necessary treatment was given. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

City\u2019s blind cricketers see new lig.description: Ludhiana: We live in a country where cricket is a religion followed by every person no matter where he or she belongs to, or the backgrounds where they come from. Six visually handicapped youngsters went to a camp in Bengaluru from June 10 to 19. This camp was organized by private institution Cabi (Cricket Association for the Blind in India), which is the apex body conducting cricket for the blind across India, having inherited the responsibility in 2010 from the former Association of Cricket for the Blind in India. "Cricket is an emotion for me, and I am very much blessed that the experience in the last days of the camp was unmatchable and indescribable. It’s my first time being a part of this camp, and I felt really good, as I have learnt a lot of things in cricket, which will help me in the future. I am really thankful to Cabi who organizes such camps for people like us. It gives us hope and courage, that even though we are blind, people are coming forward and understanding our needs,” said Rohit (19) from Ludhiana. Vishal (22), also from the city, said: “I was always fond of cricket, and being in this kind of camp gives me extra hope and courage that I can be a good sportsman. Here, I have practised batting, bowling, and fielding. In the past few days, I have seen a positive change in me, as I know I am better at all these activities because of my hard work and dedication. It's my first time in Bangalore, and I am really happy, and wish to be here next year also, to learn some new techniques and things which will help me in the future.” “The weather in Bengaluru makes me energetic, as from the first day itself, I was feeling very good. The daily routine there started in the early morning, where all our mates get ready for practice. The sessions start from 10am and end at 4.30pm. Believe me while we practise and play, I don’t think about anything else. It’s the best feeling, and one of the best moments of my life,” said Jagseer Singh (18) from Ludhiana. Anoher city-based blind cricketer Mangal Singh (22) said: “Cricket is one of the most important things of my life. I was very excited to be in the garden city. In fact, the excitment began right when I boarded the train to Bangalore. I am so happy to be a part of this camp. Only our train journey we paid for, but everything else there was free of cost, sponsored by Cabi. I am happy to see there are associations like Cabi who are here to help us. I will miss these days and moments.” Mandeep Singh (21), another city lad, said: “It took us about two days in the train, but it was worth the wait, as I was going to learn some new tips and tricks which will improve my game. Everything in the southern city was so well organized and it felt so good just being there. We used to have breakfast in the morning around 7.30am, lunch between 1-2 pm, and finally dinner every night at 8pm. Every person there was working with so much cooperation, which made me feel I was at home itself. I improved my skills in fielding and bowling, which I wanted to improve for a very long time.” “Although this camp was about cricket, there was another special thing which I personally felt good about, and that was we also had computer classes. I always wanted to try computers, and so I learnt many things here which will help me in future. It was necessary to learn these things like booking an airplane ticket, bus ticket, train ticket, movie ticket, etc. They also taught us how to use tablets. There was a one-hour class from 5-6pm, after the cricket practice. Our days there were full of learning and joy. It was my first time in that place, but I am sure I will come next time too,” said Sandeep Kumar (22) from Ludhiana. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Property tax recovery notices sent to 6.description: Ludhiana: After getting directions from mayor Balkar Sandhu and MC commissioner KP Brar, civic officials issued recovery notices to six defaulters in Zone C on Wednesday. From these six defaulters, the civic body has to recover Rs48 lakh, and they have been told to clear their property tax within one week, failing which MC would seal their premises. This year, a total of Rs100 crore has to be recovered from property tax, and every zone has been given a fixed target to be achieved by the end of March next year. The officials issued notices to United Cycle Parts Manufacturer Association (UCPMA) office at Gill Road, as the management has to pay Rs17 lakh property tax to the civic body. Notices were also issued to a hotel near Dhandhari, and an industrial unit in Zone C has been given one week’s time to pay their dues. From Zone A, the property tax target is Rs16.60 crore; from Zone B, it is Rs24.50 crore; from Zone C, it is Rs16.75 crore; and from Zone D, it is Rs42.15 crore. Confirming the move, MC superintendent Vivek Verma said they had started issuing notices to defaulters of a previous few years, and if they do not clear their dues, MC would seal the premises, and it has the power to auction properties as well. Late on Saturday evening, a long session of recovery of pending dues took place at MC’s Zone D office. Not only property tax, but other branches of MC too were told to recover pending dues as soon as possible for improving the financial condition of the civic body. The building branch officials were told to recover pending dues from defaulters who were issued challans for building bylaws violations. Meanwhile, Tehbazaari branch has been advised not to allow roadside vendors in congested areas of the city. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Strike called off after tax officials ap.description: Ludhiana: After the ongoing tussle between taxation professionals and the state taxation department, because of which tax advocates and practitioners were on a strike since last Wednesday, the tax professionals on Tuesday evening called off their strike after the Excise and Taxation Officers (ETO) Association issued an apology letter to the former. Taxation professionals had protested outside the office of the assistant excise and taxation commissioner (AETC), SK Garg, on Wednesday, claiming that he was not doing any of their works, and was delaying GST refunds deliberately. Shortly after this, the ETO Association issued a statement to the media against the protest and claimed the protest was staged by tax advocates to pressurise the AETC to do their unethical works, and defamatory slogans were made against Garg by the protestors. This statement by the association had angered tax professionals, who then called for a complete boycott of work inside the state taxation office in Ludhiana. Meanwhile, the decision to call of the strike was taken by professionals after a meeting of office-bearers of the District Taxation Bar Association (DTBA) (sales tax) with high-ranking officials of the state taxation department on Tuesday evening at the department’s office in the mini secretariat. Efforts to contact the deputy excise and taxation commissioner (Ludhiana) Pawan Garg and AETC SK Garg proved futile. Meanwhile, speaking to TOI, DTBA secretary Chander Sehgal, former president Arun Kanwal, finance secretary Gaurav Sharma and others, said: “We have called off our strike today after an apology was tendered by the ETO Association for releasing a baseless statement to the media, in which false accusations were made against us. Today’s meeting was also attended by additional excise and taxation commissioner Gurtej Singh, who has assured us that all pending works in all divisions will be completed soon, and tax-payers and tax professionals will not face any kind of problem. He has also given a time of one month to review the working of the AETC, and also assured us that the entire working in the department will be smooth.” BOX 1 ‘WE REGRET IT’, SAYS ETO BODY The letter issued by ETO Association, which is signed by its general secretary Harjot Singh, says: “In a news published in various newspapers on 13.06.2019 in response to the strike by District Taxation Bar Association, it was mentioned that the said strike had been done to pressurise officers for getting their inappropriate works done. In this regard, it is clarified that the said wording was echoed by all the excise and taxation officers of the district Ludhiana-1 in the heat of the moment at that time, but there was no intention of alleging any bar member’s integrity, and the officers, in fact, wanted to express that in such a tense environment, any mistake could happen while disposing of revenue-related work. Nevertheless, as the sentiments of the bar members have inadvertently been hurt, therefore all excise and taxation officers of Ludhiana-1 express the deepest regrets and withdraw the said words.” BOX 2 DTBA TOO ISSUES STATEMENT Later in the evening, DTBA office-bearers acting president Saket Garg, former president Arun Kanwal, finance secretary Gaurav Sharma and others issued a statement to their members saying: “As you all are aware, there was a strike going on against the poor working and arrogant behaviour of AETC-1, and ETO Association Punjab came forward and stood with AETC-1 and put a false allegation that the motive of the strike was to put pressure on officers and advocates to do their illegal works. DTBA (Sales Tax), Ludhiana took a serious note of this allegation and issued a legal notice to them and filed a complaint against them in Bar Council of Punjab and Harayana. Today, Gurtez Singh, additional excise and taxation commissioner, Punjab DETC Pawan Garg, AETC SK Garg, and office-bearer of ETO Association met bar members of DTBA (Sales Tax), Ludhiana, felt sorry, and issued a press note to that effect, giving an assurance that within one month, AETC-1 will change his working style and sort out the problems of advocates. DTBA (Sales Tax) Ludhiana is thankful to the DTBAs of Malerkotla, Faridkot, Moga, Sangrur, Hoshiarpur, and Bhatinda, who stood with us in such a difficult situation, showing the unity of tax advocates.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

DC office employees pen down strike ente.description: Ludhiana: With their agitation entering the third day, the employees of all offices under deputy commissioner, Ludhiana office, staged a demonstration against the state government for not fulfilling their demands. The employees of registry offices, additional deputy commissioner, sub-divisional magistrate and other branches have been on pen down strike from Monday due to which common people are suffering as their works are not being done at any of the offices under the deputy commissioner’s charge. The association members maintain that their strike will continue for the entire week. Meanwhile, giving more information about the strike, president of DC office employees union, Ludhiana, Parkash Singh Gill, said, “Our pen down strike has entered the third day. We have been forced to take this step as our demands are pending from years now and government is paying no attention. Some of our major demands include increasing the quota of promotion of senior assistant to naib tehsildar to 25%, giving old pension scheme to the employees who joined after April 1, 2004, filling up vacant posts superintendents, employing more staff in subdivisions etc.” He added that employees in other districts too are on strike and they have decided to not work for the entire week pressurising government to accepts their demands. Senior vice president Sukhpal Singh Pander, vice president Vikas Kumar and general secretary Davinder Bawa of the DC office employees union, Ludhiana, said, “We as government employees resolve problems of thousands of people everyday but we ourselves are facing so many problems and the government does not even bother to listen to us.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Road named in memory of boy who died in.description: PATIALA: Conceding to a demand by the people of Bhaghwanpura in Sangrur and the family of deceased, chief minister Amarinder Singh has approved the name of Sunam's Sheron Kainchian-Shero Longowal Road to Fatehveer Singh Road, in the memory of the three-year-old who lost his life in a borewell tragedy earlier this month. Sheron KainchianPWD minister Vijay Inder Singla, accompanied by Sangrur deputy commissioner Ghanshyam Thori, visited Fatehveer's family on behalf of the CM and expressed solidarity and assured all support to them. They apprised them that yielding to the request of the family and giving due honour to the untimely demise of the young soul, the state government had agreed to name the said road after him. This is categorized as another district road (ODR-01) stretching 11.8km and is being widened from 5.5 metres to 7 metres under CRF scheme. Singla said a written request in this context was made to the state government by the family of the deceased, through the office of Sangrur deputy commissioner. 21,000 DAPOs in Fatehgarh Sahib play imp.description: PATIALA: In Fatehgarh Sahib, there are over 21,000 Drug Abuse Prevention Officers (DAPOs) who are playing an important role to curb the drug menace and more than 2,466 sarpanch, panch, block samiti and zila parishad members are registered with the district administration as part of the DAPO. Around 11,827 DAPOs were registered at sub divisions and 7,090 through district Sanjh Kendra to fight a war against drugs. Fatehgarh Sahib deputy commissioner Prashant Goyal said, "People's participation in the war against drugs has been ensured through DAPO. A program under which the DAPO officials were making the masses aware of the ill effects of the drugs besides dealing with the drug affected people and their families in a sympathetic way to motivate them for the proper treatment." He said that the Punjab government has been providing free treatment to drug affected people through its Drug De-addiction centers and OOAT clinics besides organizing seminars and workshops to create awareness against drugs. Prashant claimed that DAPOs were identifying vulnerable persons in the society and were working to prevent them from falling into the quagmire of drug abuse. Moreover, they were also promoting social welfare activities, assisting in proper vigilance and security of the locality. “To save the children from this menace parents should spend plenty of time with their children and they must adopt a friendly approach towards their kids so that children would not hesitate to share their activities and views with them” he added. Human rights panel asks DC to resolve st.description: Ludhiana: Having taken a complaint against the stray dog menace seriously, the Punjab State Human Rights Commission has directed the deputy commissioner of Ludhiana to resolve the issue. In the orders, it is mentioned that the complaint was sent through e-mail by Arvind Sharma, secretary, Council of RTI Activists, Ludhiana. The complainant alleged that dog menace was on the rise in Ludhiana, and the municipal authorities were not taking any action to control it. The complainant also cited an incident where a youth was attacked by dogs. The commission had sent a copy of the complaint to DC Ludhiana for disposing of the complaint at his end in accordance with law. The action taken report should be sent to the commission before the next date of hearing, which is August 2. Notably, Jagraj Singh (35) had landed in hospital in April when stray dogs attacked him, and he lost his balance while driving his scooter. He received injuries on both his knees, and there was a fracture in his elbows. This complaint was made after the incident. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Now, Nabha jailor faces habeas corpus pe.description: PATIALA: The Nabha open jail jail superintendent now faces habeas corpus petition for not releasing former DSP Jaspal Singh, one of the convicts in Jaswant Singh Khalra kidnapping and murder case, on temporary parole. The petition was filed in the Punjab and Haryana high court on April 30, by the former DSP’s associate. According to legal experts, the state government was to challenge the court order issued in December last year, in which it had been directed to re-initiate the process of Jaspal’s premature release from jail in the Khalra kidnapping and murder case. Jaspal had moved his premature release case in October 2017, but it was rejected by the Centre in June 2018, saying, “It is not a fit case for premature release.” After the state government also turned down his case in August last year, Jaspal moved the high court in November and managed to get an order quashing state government’s decision against his premature release. The court also directed the state government to initiate the process of his release after consultation (not consent) with the Union government. It said if the government failed to take a decision in this regard within four weeks, Jaspal should be released on temporary parole. In April this year, Jaspal filed his surety bonds and secured his temporary parole, but was detained in another case of custodial death by the Nabha jail superintendent. Following this, Jaspal’s associate filed a habeas corpus in HC, saying he (Jaspal) was kept in illegal custody by the Nabha jailer. Jaspal’s counsel contended before the court, that he (Jaspal) was convicted in the Khalra murder case and faced life imprisonment and was also convicted in another custodial death case in which he was awarded five years in jail. He said both the terms were to run concurrently and that Jaspal had completed the term for custodial death while being granted temporary parole by HC in the Khalra murder case. Nabha open jail superintendent Sucha Singh said the matter was in the notice of senior officials of the jails department. “I have put all the facts before my seniors and they had taken note of the same,” he said. Meanwhile, legal expert Sukhjinder Singh said since the case had been decided by the CBI court and later upheld by the Supreme Court, the decision to release Jaspal could not have been taken without the consent of the Union home department. He said even if the HC had granted him temporary parole and asked the government to re-initiate the case of his premature release, the state government could have filed a review petition in the court. Prisoners to prepare paper bags.description: LUDHIANA: In an effort to make jails plastic-free zones, Punjab government has banned plastic bags in all jails of the state. Now, inmates will prepare paper carrybags, which will not only help eliminate plastic bags from the complexes, but also enhance the craft skills of the prisoners. Ludhiana jail superintendent Shamsher Singh Boparai said the decision was taken by Punjab chief minister Captain Amarinder Singh to save the environment from harmful impacts of plastic bags. He said in the first phase, the paper carrybags would be used in jails, and later, sold in markets. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Khanna police nab two men with 6kg opium.description: LUDHIANA: Khanna police on Thursday arrested two drug peddlers from Madhya Pradesh after it recovered 6kg of opium from them. The accused were identified as 40-year-old Jiwan Singh of Bordia Khurd in Nimach district of Madhya Pradesh and 46-year-old Dinesh of Barkhera Loya in Groth of District Mandgor in the same state. Giving details, SSP Khanna, Gursharandeep Singh Grewal said that as part of the police’s special campaign against drug trafficking and misdemeanors, a police party was patrolling from Khanna to Daheru side through service-lane, in the search of suspected persons and vehicles. He added that while patrolling, police found two suspected persons near Sports Stadium of Village Libra, who were carrying a brown colour bag. Police officer said that on seeing the police, the suspected persons tried to divert their way. He added that on suspicion, police party stopped them for checking purpose after which they identified themselves. Cops said that DSP Khanna was also present on the spot and the accused were checked in his presence as they opted for frisking in presence of gazette officer. They added that on checking of their bag, police party recovered six kilograms of opium from it that they had wrapped in polythene. SSP said that the accused were booked under sections 18/61/85 of NDPS Act at Sadar Khanna Police station and they were arrested. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rly cops carry out extensive checking at.description: Ludhiana: The government railway police, including the railway protection force, carried out extensive checking with dog squads, metal detectors at various platforms of the Ludhiana railway station on Tuesday morning. Moreover, police have been deputed at all the corners for keeping a vigil on passengers travelling from the Ludhiana railway station. Sources in the railway police department said the extensive checking of the railway station was a result of the intelligence alert in wake of the summer rush season when footfall increased to a great extent. Balbir Singh, in-charge of the government railway police, said: “After getting directions from the higher authorities, an extensive checking was carried out by both the state as well as the Central government railway security force at the Ludhiana railway station on Tuesday morning. During this special checking, the security forces were equipped with hand-handled metal detectors along with special dog squad team to tackle any unwanted situation.” “No suspicious activity was witnessed during the checking process, but some vendors were caught which were moving without permission. The police, however, left them with a warning.” The railway police will continue with such checking in the coming days to maintain peace and harmony at the Ludhiana railway station. More CCTVs cameras will also be installed. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. 1,836 appear for vet entrance exam.description: LUDHIANA: Guru Angad Dev Veterinary and Animal Sciences University (Gadvasu) conducted the Veterinary Entrance Test (VET-2019) for admission to undergraduate program — Bachelor of Veterinary Science & Animal Husbandry (BVSc & AH). Dr Narinder Singh Sharma, controller of examinations, revealed that a total of 1,974 candidates had applied for admission to this course of which 1836 (93%) candidates — 1,040 boys and 795 girls — appeared in the entrance test held at two centres at RS Model Senior Secondary School and BCM Arya Model Senior Secondary School, Shastri Nagar, Ludhiana. The test was conducted for 76 seats of BVSc & AH for Ludhiana, 80 seats for Rampura Phul and 42 seats for Khalsa College of Veterinary and Animal Sciences, Amritsar. The result is likely to be declared in the next three days and will be available online at the university website (www.gadvasu.in). Dr Sushil Prabhakar, registrar, Gadvasu, said first counselling for BVSc & AH is scheduled for July 22. He also informed that the date for applying in degree programs in BFSc, BTech (biotechnology) and BTech (dairy technology) has been extended to July 1, 2019 without late fee and July 8, 2019 with late fee. The candidates can apply to admission to these programmes online (www.gadvasu.in) and offline (on paper application). There is no entrance test for admission to Bachelor of Fisheries Science (BFSc), BTech (biotechnology) and BTech (dairy technology). The admissions will be made on the basis of marks obtained in Class XII exam from any recognized Indian board. Now the candidates from medical as well as from non-medical streams will be eligible to get admission in these programmes. Besides, a number of seats in all these programs has also been increased. The first counselling for 75 seats of BFSc (Bachelor of Fisheries Science), 50 of BTech (Biotechnology) and 75 of BTech (Dairy Technology) for Ludhiana is scheduled on July 23 at the Silver Jubilee Auditorium, University Veterinary Hospital, opposite Nanaksar Gurdwara, Ferozepur Road, Ludhiana. 450kg plastic bags seized from Gill Road.description: LUDHIANA: Continuing with their ongoing drive against plastic carry bags, joint teams of Ludhiana municipal corporation (MC) and Punjab Pollution Control Board (PPCB) raided shops at Gill Road on Thursday and seized around 450kg banned plastic carry bags. During the raids, challans were issued by MC officials to the erring shopkeepers, and the plastic carry bags were confiscated. The officials first raided Shakti Plastic, New Cycle Market, Miller Ganj, and confiscated 170kg plastic carry bags from there. Then they visited Davindra Industries, Gill Road, and confiscated 206kg plastic carry bags. From Saluja Plastic Industry, Miller Ganj, Ludhiana, they confiscated 28kg plastic carry bags. After this Batra Plastic, Batra Plastic-2, Gupta Agencies, Goyal Plastic— all in Miller Ganj— were raided. However, no plastic carry bags were found at site. From Pupneja Plastic, Miller Ganj, 31kg plastic carry bags were confiscated. 10 were seized from Pannu Pakore, Gill Road. The medical officer from health department, Vipul Malhotra said, “Raids are being conducted frequently. Offenders are being issued challans for keeping plastic carry bags which have already been banned in the state.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Revaluation helped her top district in C.description: Ludhiana: Unhappy with her Class X score, Khushboo Sharma applied for revaluation after a week of the CBSE result, which was declared on May 6, and found her ranking scale to the best in the district, along with two other students. A student of DAV School, BRS Nagar, Khushboo had scored 492 out of 500 on the first count of her scores. But she believed she deserved more and applied for a recount, which took her score to 494 out of 500. “When I saw the score of 492, I hung my head in shame. I expected more. I was not satisfied with the given marks.” she said. “In English, I had to get two additional marks. I knew that would be possible as I was confident I had performed really well.” She applied for revaluation after checking the scanned copy of her answersheets and ascertained she should have got an extra two marks in the writing section. Khushboo had to wait for nearly one-and-a-half month to get the revised scores. “I felt very happy after revaluation. My preparations for exams were rigorous. Teachers helped me prepare better. Solving old papers was also helpful. Next, I’m hoping to score best in the district in medical,” she added. Her parents — Dr Chetanya Sharma (father) and Dr Anju Sharma (mother) are dentists. Her sister Misha is in Class IX in the same school. They are residents of Purana Bazar near Daresi. “I study for 16 hours during exams and eight hours on a regular basis. I have never gone for tuitions. I used to self study,” she added. Singing and painting act as her stress-busters. Finally, getting a score of 98.8%, Khushboo jointly topped the district with two other students of different private schools of the city. Avni Aggarwal of KVM (Civil Lines), and Navish Mittal of DAV Public School (Jagraon), had also secured the top position earlier. As per the result declared on May 6, Khushboo’s percentage was 98.4%, and she was placed second in merit in the school and third in the city. After re-evaluation, when her score went up by two marks in English from 76/80 to 78/80, her aggregate percentage jumped to 98.8%, which makes her a topper in the school, and a joint topper in Ludhiana district. Man arrested for raping boutique owner.description: LUDHIANA: Sidhwan Bet Police on Wednesday arrested a person for raping and assaulting a boutique owner. In her police complaint, the 25-year-old woman from a village said she had been operating a boutique from her house and had been teaching embroidery to two sisters of the accused. She said the accused troubling her since 2013 and used to call her repeatedly despite her objection. She alleged that the accused had threatened to kill her and her family members. She added that in June 2013, despite resistance, he sexually assaulted her by threatening to defame her and her family in the village. She alleged that he had raped her on several occasions since 2013. She said in February 2019, her family got her engaged to a youth from a different village and when he came to know about it, he threatened to kill her if she didn’t refuse the proposal. She said on 14 June, the accused came to her house and told her to accompany him. And when she refused to do so, he thrashed her and tore her shirt. She said when she raised the alarm, the accused fled the spot. She claimed the accused went to the village of her fiancée, following which the fiancée called off the wedding. Afterwards, she informed police about the incidents. Sidhwan Bet police have registered a case under Sections 376 (rape), 323 (Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), 452 (House-trespass after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint), 354 b (Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe), 506 (criminal intimidation) of the IPC. Police officials said the accused has been arrested. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Demolition of bridge on Buddha Nullah st.description: LUDHIANA: BJP councillor Sunita Rani, along with residents of Ward 85, staged a protest against civic officials who had come to raze a bridge over Buddha Nullah near Jain Nagar on Thursday. The officials of MC’s Bridges and Roads department had come to dismantle the bridge with a plea that during the rainy season, garbage gets collected under the bridge, and water does not find a way to move ahead. Residents rued that the bridge was being used by several people daily, and if it is dismantled, they would have to cross the area from another bridge, which remains crowded. However, with the intervention of mayor Balkar Sandhu, protestors were pacified, and civic officials moved away without carrying on the demolition. A team of civic officials had reached the area on Thursday morning for demolishing the bridge, but residents had started gathering at the place, and before civic officials could take any step, they started opposing the move. The residents and the councillor sat on the bridge and started raising slogans against the civic authorities. Sunita Rani said the bridge was mostly used by pedestrians, and generally women passed through the bridge, because there was an illegal fish market nearby, and it was difficult for women to use another bridge near Shivpuri. She said officials were turning a blind eye towards the illegal fish market, and one bridge in a dilapidated condition needed to be dismantled. She said they ended their protest only when the mayor first assured that inspection would be done at the spot, and only after that would any decision be taken. This bridge has been used for quite a long time. In 1998, a concrete bridge was constructed, and in 2004, it was repaired as well. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Here is a list of contituencies with prominent candiadates or clashes. CMO faces demotion over fake disability.description: Ludhiana: The chief medical officer (by the rank deputy director) of the district, Dr Palvinderpal Singh, got demoted as SMO as he was not physically challenged to the extent of being eligible for quota promotion. He was yet given benefits on fake certificates. The civil surgeon got promotion on March 15, 2018, allegedly on the basis of a fake disability certificate, which was exposed in a probe conducted by the state government last year. The authorities ordered a fresh medical examination in October last year following complaints that Dr Parvinderpal Singh, who was serving in Ludhiana, was not physically challenged to the extent of being eligible for quota promotion, yet was given benefit on fake certificates. As per the report submitted by the Government Medical College, Patiala, Dr Parvinderpal Singh, civil surgeon, Ludhiana, was found 23.34% per cent disabled as compared to the certificate which mentioned 45 per cent disability. His certificate had mentioned that he was suffering from forward bending of spine and ankle disability. He has now become ineligible for disability quota promotion. As per the disability certification guidelines, any person having only more than 40 per cent physical disability is eligible for the promotion under the quota. Satish Chandra, additional chief secretary, health, confirmed the findings of the re-examination and said: “We accepted the Patiala report and the CMO has been demoted. The new CMO will be appointed by Wednesday.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

As STPs fail, PPCB slaps MC with Rs 75L.description: Ludhiana: Acting tough against poor functioning of sewage treatment plants (STPs) at Balloke, Bhattian and Jamalpur, the Punjab Pollution Control Board (PPCB) has directed the Ludhiana municipal corporation to deposit Rs 75 lakh (Rs 25 lakh on each STP) as bank guarantee that could be forfeited if the civic body fails to perform its job. Besides, the MC has been directed to deposit a fine equivalent to the amount it spends in one month on the operation and maintenance of the STPs. The action has been taken after PPCB took note of failed samples of treated water at the STPs which ultimately pollutes Buddha Nullah and Satluj river. The test of water samples at the STPs had revealed high levels of COD and BOD even after treatment of water at the plants. The sources said 46 treatment plants out of 84 STPs monitored in the state don’t comply with norms and Ludhiana STPs are among these 46 STPs. After conducting hearing of MC officials, the PPCB chairman issued the directions the MC to deposit the bank guarantee and pay fine for spoiling the environment. Several complaints had been made regarding non-functional STPs of MC due to which untreated water is being discharged in the drain. The Satluj pollution had affected lives in Rajasthan too where people have fallen sick after consuming the water. Sandeep Behl, senior environment engineer, PPCB said, “Despite repeated complaints and recommendations, MC did not act and upgraded its STPs. Now the situation is such that treated water does not fulfill the norms.” He said they have sought this bank guarantee from the MC just to ensure that civic body will upgrade the STPs by March 2021 as per the deadline. Meanwhile, the PPCB has also refused to giving consent to these STPs, saying that these needed to be upgraded properly. Karunesh Garg, member secretary, PPCB, said, “The MC is not serious in fulfilling its role towards the city residents and that is why they have never understood the seriousness of the issue.” He said as the matter is now with the National Green Tribunal and panel members are reviewing it regularly, it has to be seen whether the MC act now or not. The PPCB had also imposed Rs 50 lakh bank guarantee on MC for not fulfilling the solid waste management rules, but till now, the civic body has not paid the same. The civic officials have sought 10 days to deposit the bank guarantee to PPCB. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Women peddling drugs on the rise in dist.description: Ludhiana: A few days ago, the anti-narcotics wing of the Ludhiana rural police had arrested a woman of Parjian Biharipur, here, and her brother-in-law with 82 grams of heroin in Sidhwan Bet. The wing had found that it was Harpreet Kaur’s first venture into drug peddling. Her brother-in-law was identified as Ramesh Singh. In the second such case around the same time, the Ludhiana rural police had arrested another woman, Raju, from Mandiani village in Dakha after 45 illegal drug tablets were recovered from her. On June 9, the anti-narcotics wing had nabbed woman peddler Surinder Kaur of Gorsian Khan Muhammad along with a male peddler after 24 grams of heroin was recovered from them during a checking at Gorsian Kadar Baksh in Sidhwan Bet. These are not isolated cases in Ludhiana rural areas. The officials of the anti-narcotics wing said women peddlers have become a dangerous emerging trend. Wing in-charge inspector Navdeep Singh said they have arrested about seven women peddlers from various areas under Ludhiana rural jurisdiction in the past two months. He said about 20 of them were on their watchlist. Officials said half a kilogram of heroin was recovered from 15 women peddlers in the past six months. They added that these peddlers were mostly involved in selling heroin and only a few carried drug tablets and poppy husk. An officer of the anti-narcotics wing said most of the women were from families whose men were in the trade and were not able to go out or were in jail. The women were using their men’s network and selling drugs to their customers. Wing officials said about 50% of such peddlers were educated women who knew about drugs and ventured into the trade for easy money. Some of them were addicts as well, they added. BOX Sidhwan Bet the hotbed The anti-narcotics wing in-charge said they have arrested women peddlers from across Ludhiana rural areas, including Dakha, Raikot, Hathur and Jodhan, but most arrests were made from Sidhwan Bet. Why heroin? Wing officials said because of the small size and large profit, heroin peddling was a natural choice for women. They use private parts to carry heroin and police have to work hard to meet the norms of the NDPS Act, as per which a woman constable checks the peddler in closed doors. They said women constables were well trained to check such carriers. Young blood A wing officer said about 80% of women peddlers were in the age group of 20 to 35 years. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. In Video:Won't decide who will be the next president of Congress: Rahul GandhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Monsoon measures: DC directs officials t.description: Ludhiana: On a day when it cats and dogs in Ludhiana, deputy commissioner Pradeep Kumar Agrawal on Thursday reviewed arrangements to deal with floods in the district. Chairing a high-level meeting of all departments at the Bachat Bhawan, the DC instructed the officials to constantly coordinate with each other via the WhatsApp group to closely monitor the situation in the monsoon season. He ordered the officials to keep their mobile phones ‘switched on’ round the clock and any kind of indiscipline will not be tolerated. He suggested them to share information about the situation regularly in the group. District heads of all departments will work as a nodal officer for necessary arrangements and communications. He ordered the sub-divisional magistrates (SDMs) to install wireless public address system in one vehicle to alert the people in the situation of floods. He also asked NDRF and Army officials to take the stock of sensitive places along with administration teams before the monsoon season starts. Agrawal said SDMs will ensure the working of the flood control rooms round the clock and asked them to depute employees in shifts. The DC instructed executive engineer drainage to keep a close vigil on all spots which were identified as sensitive during the inspections. The irrigation department’s officials will ensure the cleanliness of distributaries to save the crops in the situation of flood and MC commissioner, executive officers and deputy director local bodies will have the responsibility of clearing drains. Agrawal asked the SDMs to make adequate arrangements to meet any sort of situation season and sufficient stock of boats, oars, life-saving jackets, motor engines, sandbags, wireless system, manpower, machinery, and tarpaulins should be ensured. Officials said they have already started making arrangements. Additional deputy commissioner (ADC) Jagraon Neeru Katyal Gupta, ADC Khanna Jaspal Singh and heads of departments were present in the meeting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Cops admit villager to de-addiction cent.description: Ludhiana: Seeking to get an addict de-addicted, Hathur police on Wednesday got him admitted to a de-addiction centre in Jagraon after motivating him with the help of villagers to give up addiction. Giving details, SHO of Hathur police station, sub-inspector Simarjeet Singh, said they had come to know that Sajan Singh (27) of the area was hooked to heroin for the past two-and-a-half years. He added that after getting this information, they contacted prominent villagers, including Kamalpura sarpanch Sukhpreet Singh, Mandeep Singh Khalsa, and Master Darshan Singh among others, and then talked to the addict. The police officer said with the support of villagers and BDPO Ravinderpal Singh, they convinced Sajan to go for de-addicition. He added that after he agreed, they got him admitted in a de-addiction centre, where he would undergo de-addiction, with the government spending for it. The SHO said Sajan’s mother remained ill, and was in Chandigarh for treatment, while his father was dead. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Safai karamcharis stage protest at Punja.description: PATIALA: Protesting delay in salaries, cleanliness workers or safai karamcharis of Punjabi University on Thursday dumped garbage outside the offices of the university registrar and other officials. They also said that the protest was triggered after the university failed to keep its promise of making their jobs permanent. The workers dumped garbage all over the campus, including at the university gate, outside office of registrar, near engineering department. They have even threatened to continue their strike for the next one week. Meanwhile, it has been learned that after their protest, their salaries were credited to their accounts. Jatinder Kala, the president of the cleanliness workers' union said, "The university has been delaying salaries every month. We are forced to hold protests to get our salaries. The university authorities are apathetic towards class IV employees." "The university had assured to regularize contractual workers, however has failed," he added. He said that the workers will continue holding the protest for a week till their demands were met. Rakesh Kumar, incharge of finance, could not be contacted for comments. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Crime File.description: 230g heroin recovered Division 3 police have arrested Arvinderpal Singh of Dhokka Mohalla with 230g heroin, and a case registered against him. He was arrested near Veer Haqiqat School while consuming the drug. Teenage girl goes missing Premwati of Jawaddi Kalan told police that her daughter Pushpa Devi (19), who worked as a domestic help in the locality, said she had gone for her work on Monday, but did not return. She alleged someone had abducted her on the pretext of marriage. Dugri police registered a case against unidentified accused. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

SAD leaders give memo to DC over beating.description: Ludhiana: The leaders of district Akali Dal handed over a memorandum to DC for the Union home minister against the beating up of a Sikh taxi driver and his son recently in Delhi. They demanded action against cops who beat the taxi driver and his son brutally. The leaders claimed that if they had done any crime, then the cops had every right to arrest them, but it was inhuman to beat them on the road and then drag them like animals. SAD district president Ranjit Dhillon said they had handed over a memorandum to DC as a protest against this incident in Delhi. He said the cops responsible for the incident should be terminated from their job, and legal action be taken against them, so that in future, nobody dares do any such thing. Meanwhile, Youth Akali Dal (YAD) district president Gurdeep Singh Gosha met Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) president and former deputy chief minister Sukhbir Singh Badal, and thanked him for taking up issues of the Sikh community in Shillong and Delhi with the central government. Gosha said after SAD’s intervention, Delhi Police had suspended three policemen and registered a case. Also, the matter of Sikhs in Shillong was solved.
